metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46880 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A missing check related to tex units could have led to a use-after-free andpotentially exploitable crash.
*Note*: This advisory was added onDecember 13th, 2022 after we better understood the impact of the issue. Thefix was included in the original release of Firefox 105. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox ESR < 102.6, Firefox < 105, and Thunderbird < 102.6. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46880` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
